website.static:
WikiFIX is now online.

QuickFIX 1.9.2 is available! Please see the release notes.

QuickFIX support contracts now available.

QuickFIX is a full-featured open source FIX engine, currently compatible with the FIX 4.0-4.4 spec. It runs on Windows, Linux, Solaris, FreeBSD and Mac OS X. API's are available for C++, Java, .NET, and Python.

page.title: About
page.section: QuickFIX is a full-featured open source FIX engine, currently compatible with the FIX 4.0-4.4 spec. It runs on Windows, Linux, Solaris, FreeBSD and Mac OS X. API's are available for C++, Java, .NET, and Python. Learn more.

The Financial Information eXchange (FIX) Protocol is a "language" which defines specific kinds of electronic messages for communicating securities transactions between two parties. FIX defines only the format of the messages and the session-level interaction between two applications. More information on FIX can be found at the FIX protocol web site.

Documentation The best way to get started is with the online documentation, also provided with every QuickFIX download. The documentation helps you with installation, setting up your projects, creating applications, configuration and code samples for all supported APIs.
Mailing Lists QuickFIX has a very active user and development community. Join our mailing lists and take advantage of our knowledge and helpful disposition. Mailing lists messages all get stored in a searchable archive. You can choose to receive emails as they come, in daily batches, or not at all if you prefer to browse through the archives.
Wiki Wikis provide an environment ideal for collaborative content management where anyone can contribute. This is a good place to get up to date information on what is happening with QuickFIX.
Bug Tracker We have recently added a public defect tracker. Here you can report defects and monitor their progress.
Support Contracts Support contracts and consulting services are available for purchase. You can ensure the someone will be available to assist you, guaranteed. We have offices in in North America and Europe, and provide several levels of support depending on your needs.

Need more information? Email us at ask@quickfixengine.org.

-->

Here is a list of free third party tools that can be used in conjunction with QuickFIX. These utilities are in no way affiliated with QuickFIX and are supported by their respective companies or organizations.

Product Company Description
Ethereal Ethereal A very powerful and full featured network protocol analyzer which support hundred of protocols, including FIX. Use this to sniff out all FIX traffic regardless of what FIX engine it originates from.
FIXionary Javelin Technologies Interactively browse the FIX protocol specification through this java application. Much nicer then browsing through the massive word documents or XML dictionaries. Can be downloaded or used online.
FIX Data Dictionary transacttools Similar to FIXionary, but lighter weight. Only available online
FIXopaedia b2bits Another lightweght online FIX reference
Stunnel Stunnel.org Allows you to encrypt arbitrary TCP connections inside SSL. Use this to encrypt your FIX sessions without need to modify you're application code.

page.title: Documentation
page.section: Complete instructions are available for installing QuickFIX and running the acceptance tests.
We also maintain a wiki to provide a forum for discussion and collaboration.
For help with the FIX protocol itself, check out the FIX Protocol Homepage. Of particular interest are the specification documents and the discussion forums

page.title: XML
page.section:
We created a parser to go through the FIX specs and generated well formed XML versions. We use this XML version to generate most of the code for our FIX engine. Seeing as though it is so useful for us, we figured other people might be interested too.

This is a machine readable version of the FIX specification. If you have been looking for such a thing, this is it!

  • FIX 4.0 xml html
  • FIX 4.1 xml html
  • FIX 4.2 xml html
  • FIX 4.3 xml html
  • FIX 4.4 xml html

    • The XML documents were then reformatted into small browsable HTML files using this xsl stylesheet

The FPL has recently released an xml repository for the FIX protocol. This repository is available to FPL members only. We have created a script that will convert from the FPL repository into a QuickFIX data dictionary in the format of the ones available above. Simply place this script in the root directory of the unzipped schema, and run it. It will scan for all directories in the format of FIX.x.y and create a FIXxy.xml file where x is the major and y is the minor version of FIX. You will need a ruby interpreter.

Download Script: fix_to_quickfix.rb

page.title: Developers
page.section: Report and follow-up on bug reports here.
The source code for QuickFIX can be accessed by browsing the current CVS tree.

login
cvs -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/quickfix login

checkout
cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/quickfix co quickfix

When prompted for a password for anonymous, simply hit [return].

More information about CVS access can be found at out SourceForge CVS page

page.title: Services
page.section:
Connamara Systems and Macdonald and Associates have teamed up to provide formal QuickFIX support, consulting, and training. Both these companies have been very supportive of the QuickFIX project. We are pleased to recognize them as preferred service providers.

If you are interested in learning about QuickFIX, FIX, and trading related services, just email us at ask@quickfixengine.org. Please leave your contact information such as email or a telephone number where you can be reached.

QuickFIX also offers joint consulting services with SmartQuant, Ltd. They are the makers of the popular QuantStudio framework for data analysis and trading. Together, we are able to provide the set of tools, connectivity, and integration required for a complete trading system.

With offices in Chicago and New Delhi, Connamara Systems, LLC provides FIX consulting, QuickFIX support and custom trading systems development service to the equities and derivatives trading industries. Connamara was an initial collaborator in the creation of QuickFIX and continues to contribute to the enhancements and maintenance of the engine. More information can be found at www.connamara.com

Macdonald Associates Ltd., founded in 1983, has a pan-European presence covering the UK, Switzerland and Germany. The company has a range of trading products in the equity and fixed income markets and also offers training and consulting to financial institutions. Macdonald has been active in the QuickFIX community and uses QuickFIX within their own product line. For more details, see www.macd.com or email george.macdonald@macd.com

QuantStudio is an advanced financial framework that enables users to develop, test & implement their own quantitative trading strategies & applications over multiple asset classes. Their mission is to deliver a framework offering a complete set of features and tools for financial data analysis and trading. Find out more about QuantStudio at http://www.smartquant.com.
